newsitem.title: USA: Entergy 836 MW Ark. nuke trips off line.
newsitem.headline: Entergy 836 MW Ark. nuke trips off line.

text.p: Entergy Corp's 836 megawatt Arkansas nuclear power unit 1 unexpectedly tripped off line Friday and was producing no electricity, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said.
The unit, located at Russellville, Ark., experienced a "reactor trip due to two out of four RCP's tripping," the NRC said in its daily plant status report.
A company spokeswoman was not immediately available for comment.
The Arkansas nuclear unit 2, at the same site and with a capacity of 858 megawatts, was operating at 98 percent of capacity as of early Friday, the NRC said.
